name: Example: Import runbooks from an existing runbook deployment
description: Provides instructions to export runbooks from one deployment, and to import them to another deployment. Uses the RBA API for both operations. Step 2 explains how to define the runbook parameter values, so you can start this runbook without having defined the parameter values at first.

steps.title: Set the value of SOURCE_BASEURL to specify the deployment where you want to export runbooks from
Set the value of TARGET_BASEURL to specify the deployment where you want to import runbooks to
Generate source API key and set the value of SOURCE_AUTHENTICATION
Generate target API key and set the value of TARGET_AUTHENTICATION
Test the connectivity to the source RBA API endpoint (optional)
Test the connectivity to the target RBA API endpoint (optional)

parameters.name: SOURCE_BASEURL
parameters.description: See step 2 for instructions how to create the value for this parameter. You can start with an empty value but you have to supply a value before proceeding to step 3.

parameters.name: TARGET_BASEURL
parameters.description: See step 3 for instructions how to create the value for this parameter. You can start with an empty value but you have to supply a value before proceeding to step 4.

parameters.name: SOURCE_AUTHENTICATION
parameters.description: See step 4 for instructions how to create the value for this parameter. You can start with an empty value but you have to supply a value before proceeding to step 5.

parameters.name: TARGET_AUTHENTICATION
parameters.description: See step 5 for instructions how to create the value for this parameter. You can start with an empty value but you have to supply a value before proceeding to step 6.

parameters.name: SOURCE_SINGLERUNBOOKID
parameters.description: If only a single runbook should get exported, set this parameter to the forward slash (/) followed by the runbook ID
